content:
hl7-fhircast-bot opened Issue #201

## May 2019 Ballot Comment:

Submitted by Anthony Julian
Chapter/section: Intent Verification Response
Url: https://fhircast.hl7.org/specification/May2019Ballot/index.html
Type: NEG :exclamation: Clarification
In Person requested: Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Summary:

Comment: See note on ANSI modal Verbs; also mandate lowercase on the string unsubscribe.

Existing wording: Once a subscribing app no longer wants to receive event notifications, it MUST unsubscribe from the session. The unsubscribe request message mirrors the subscribe request message with only a single difference: the hub.mode MUST be equal to the string unsubscribe.
Proposed wording: Once a subscribing app no longer wants to receive event notifications, it SHALL unsubscribe from the session. The unsubscribe request message mirrors the subscribe request message with only a single difference: the hub.mode SHALL be equal to the string 'unsubscribe' lower case.

_This issue was imported by @hl7-fhircast-bot from the consolidated FHIRcast May 2019 ballot spreadsheet._

hl7-fhircast-bot labeled Issue #201

Comment: See note on ANSI modal Verbs; also mandate lowercase on the string unsubscribe.

Existing wording: Once a subscribing app no longer wants to receive event notifications, it MUST unsubscribe from the session. The unsubscribe request message mirrors the subscribe request message with only a single difference: the hub.mode MUST be equal to the string unsubscribe.
Proposed wording: Once a subscribing app no longer wants to receive event notifications, it SHALL unsubscribe from the session. The unsubscribe request message mirrors the subscribe request message with only a single difference: the hub.mode SHALL be equal to the string 'unsubscribe' lower case.

isaacvetter commented on Issue #201

NOTE on ANSI modal verbs: The usage of ANSI modal verbs consistently provides a vehicle for quickly discerning the conformance criteria.
HL7 adheres to ISO/IEC directive, Appendix G: ANSI modal verbs ("SHALL", "SHOULD", "MAY", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD NOT", "MAY NOT") SHALL be capitalized. See FHIR conformance rules, section 2.1.0.1 "Conformance Language". http://hl7.org/implement/standards/fhir/conformance-rules.html

isaacvetter commented on Issue #201

Two issues in this comment:
1) Use SHALL instead of MUST per HL7 FHIR
2) >mandate lowercase on the string unsubscribe
We do define the hub.mode parameter as:
Existing wording: >The literal string "subscribe" or "unsubscribe", depending on the goal of the request.

Inserting the word, "lowercase" into this sentence seems reasonable.

Proposed wording: >The literal, lowercase string "subscribe" or "unsubscribe", depending on the goal of the request.

isaacvetter edited a comment on Issue #201

Two issues in this comment:
1) Use SHALL instead of MUST per HL7 FHIR
2) >mandate lowercase on the string unsubscribe

We do define the hub.mode parameter as:

Existing wording: >The literal string "subscribe" or "unsubscribe", depending on the goal of the request.

Inserting the word, "lowercase" into this sentence seems reasonable.

Proposed wording: >The literal, lowercase string "subscribe" or "unsubscribe", depending on the goal of the request.

wmaethner labeled Issue #201
